clinical_study.brief_title: Validity of Physical Activity Questionnaires in Persons Pursuing Bariatric Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Validity of Physical Activity Questionnaires in Persons Pursuing Bariatric Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the validity of the Human Activity Profile and Godin self-report questionnaires of physical activity in persons seeking metabolic surgery.

detailed_description.textblock: This cross-sectional study will collect subject's medical history, anthropometric measurements, physical activity data through an accelerometer worn on the wrist and indirect physical activity measures via the Human Activity Profile and Godin self-report questionnaires. We will collect clinical information from the medical record including predictors of physical activity level in obesity such as nutritional lab and co-morbid conditions.

primary_outcome.description: Self-report questionnaire - indirect measure of physical activity

secondary_outcome.measure: Godin-Shephard Leisure Time Physical Activity (Godin) questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: Self-report questionnaire - indirect measure of physical activity

intervention.description: Self-report questionnaires assessing physical activity level.
intervention.other_name: Godin-Shephard Leisure Time Physical Activity Questionnaire

study_pop.textblock: Patients seeking bariatric surgery at University of Nebraska Medical Center/Nebraska Medicine

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age >19
- BMI > 30
- Able to speak and understand English
- Consent to provide access to medical records for medical history
- Will receive weight loss procedure (sleeve gastrectomy or gastric bypass) at Nebraska Medicine
- Consent to wear an activity tracker device for 7 days after designated visits.
